channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sensor for traffic from Turney Road not working, 9th January
item.description:
The sensor on the light controlling traffic turning from Turney Road onto Dulwich Village is not working, meaning the traffic light sticks on red for long periods. This issue has persisted for several weeks and is now a serious safety concern - the light stays red for so long that some cars have started to run the red light. This is dangerous for children crossing the road to attend Hamlet School or DVIS.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dulwich Village, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burst water pipe, 9th January
item.description:
A pipe has burst or the corner of Tulse Hill and Brailsford Road and water is pouring down the street towards the crossroads. This has been happening for about a week.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Tulse Hill, Brixton, Greater London

item.title: Large flooded area of pavement, 9th January
item.description:

item.title: Grass Damage, 9th January
item.description:
Yet again the grass in Croydon Rd Recreation Ground has been damaged/destroyed by council/contractors vehicles been driven over it. In this particular instance they appeared to be doing a visual inspection of something so easily could have parked up and walked. The state of the grass in many areas is very bad and it’s unbelievable it’s being caused by the organisation supposed to be maintaining it! (The cordoned off area near the toilet block is a marshy swamp this was also caused by contractor vehicles.).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waldens Road, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light out, 9th January
item.description:
Street light out for nearly 2months, It is very dark, have elderly and young children, when trying to put them in the car, the road is very busy anyway, and can get dangerous when trying to do this safely .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 193, Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars outside Dulwich Village Infants School, 9th January
item.description:
Could you consider a no stopping sign and camera outside Dulwich Village Infants School that runs the entire length of the school's estate up to where the zebra crossing is? Alternatively could you have a parking attendant there 07.40am onwards until 09.00 and then again around 15.00 - 15.40? Irresponsible drivers are stopping, putting on hazard lights and then leaving their vehicles to dropping off and collect children and today is the third occasion that I have seen an accident narrowly avoided when a cyclist tried to get round a car and was almost hit by a driver. It feels like a serious accident is imminent.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Dulwich Village, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
